dialogues.text: He turns around to see Duane,  sitting stone-faced across from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearly thrilled) Sorry, I couldn't help it.  I just got  carried away... (finally letting it out) ... I was really good though, hunh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duane keeps staring at him.   Dave shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cluing Duane in) So I guess there must be something  pretty important going on for the  President to go through all of this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duane just looks at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A discarded tuxedo lies tossed across a chair along with woman's bra and pantyhose. The CAMERA PANS THROUGH DARKNESS SLOWLY TOWARD the bed wh the sound of a MAN and WOMAN MAKING LOVE plays O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA ARRIVES AT the bed as the torso of Randi,  the Oval Office secretary, pops INTO FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Longer pause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened)                                   Oh; shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red and white ambulance sits parked at the service entr to the hotel with its red light flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President is loaded onto a gurney bed with an array o tubes and catheters.  The CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal Bob Reed, Sitting in a corner, while the medical drama unfold before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) It doesn't look very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little softer) They say it hit both sides of his  brain... Even if he makes it he's gonna  be a vegetable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe he'd do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob stares straight ahead clutching onto his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a little hysterical right now.   We've got her upstairs in a laundry  room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Nightmare...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning closer) Look... at some point we're going to  have to call the Vice President...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Don't call the Vice President!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing his lapels) Just don't call him, Alan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (treading softly) The guy's in a coma, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is mine, Al -- all mine ...          I made him. I built him.  And no  cocksucker is gonna come in here and  take it away from me just because he   to be Vice President of the United  States!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: He looks at Reed for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave sits in the back seat with Duane.   He has his small canvas bag opened beside him on the seat.  He finishes ge dressed in his own clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jacked) You know if you guys want to do  something for his birthday,  I could  come down to Washington.  I have some  great birthday stuff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duane smiles at him tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do this thing with the first lady --  my friends love it -- it's the two of  them going away to Club Med...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duane just looks at him when the TELEPHONE RINGS beside h He reaches next to him, picking it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?..  Are you sure?  What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocently) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The famous building is lit up like a picture postcard whi Bob's voice plays 0.S...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a temporary solution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A doctor and two nurses wheel a gurney in front of them w Bob and Reed trail behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Till what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TilT we figure something out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, the guy had a stroke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed looks at him like he's nuts as they turn a corner in hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, everything can be handled.  We'll  just find a way to handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping) Like how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile) Well, start by going on television and saying that he's had a mild  stroke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mild stroke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes - - and that he ought to be up                    and around sometime soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up and around?  Soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: A lone black limousine heads down Connecticut Avenue towa the mall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know,  I think I've been real  cooperative up until now but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It bears right on Pennsylvania Avenue, angling south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me where we're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car turns right into the driveway of the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave sits frozen in an armchair across from the President desk.  There are twenty-foot windows that lead out to the Rose Garden and two huge flags on either side of the desk Alan Reed leans nonchalantly on one of the chairs.    Bob stands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all schmooz) Dave, my name is Alan Reed.  I'm the  White House Communications Director.   This is Bob Alexander, our Chief of  Staff. (smiling) We met you earlier tonight at the hotel,  remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave nods, frozen in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you something to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?  A Coke or a Perrier or  something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still frozen) Oh yeah... 1'm fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed flashes him a smile and glances over at Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving toward him) Now, Dave, something has come up and I  think we need to talk about it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blurting it out) Look, I'm sorry.  I know you said not  to talk, but when I saw the crowd I  just got excited...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not upset with you, Dave.  We  think you did a terrific job. (to Bob) Don't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all tension) Terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed smiles at Dave, who musters a little smile in return

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, we think you did such a good  job, we'd like to extend things a little  bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extend things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Extend them. (beat) C'mere for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He places a hand on Dave's shoulder and motions toward th desk.  Dave hesitates,  then follows him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed pulls out the President's chair and motions to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave looks down at the chair in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave pauses for a moment then sinks down into the soft br leather.   He stares out in awe across the Oval Office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed looks over at Bob, who nods at  him.    He takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, something has happened to the  President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whirling) Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soothing him) I know...  I know... (pause) It's difficult for all of us.  But  sometimes we have to put our personal  feelings aside and focus on the gQod  of the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's...  It's sort of an... an  `incident'  really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) A condition...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. A condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave nods but still doesn't understand.   Reed hesitates Bob glares at him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's actually kind of serious, Dave.   I'm afraid the President's not in very  good shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (actually shaken) Oh my gosh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits there,  stunned for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will he be alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah... probably...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, we need our friends and even our  enemies to feel safe and secure...  We  need them to feel like they can go to  bed at night knowing President Mitchell  is fully in control... We need them to  feel like he's sitting right here in  this chair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Reed just stare at him.   Dave nods,  then sudden jumps out of the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey - - wait a second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at them for a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the Vice President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked) Vice Presidant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... We didn't want to have to get  into this but... (deadly serious) ... The Vice President is mentally  unbalanced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed's eyes go wide.  Bob stares straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching on) I'm afraid so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?   Crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certifiable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave looks at them amazed.  Bob moves closer to the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you usually get paid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lost...) Uh -- I don't know.   Sometimes it's  just like a barter thing...  Is this  legal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed stops and looks at Bob for a moment.    He turns bac Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evenly) Dave - - have you ever driven through  a red light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, on an empty road where you  know it's safe and nobody's around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure... I might have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well,  let's say your mother was in  the car and you had to get her to a  hospital.  You'd do it then for sure  wouldn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I gues I would... Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Now,  let's say the whole country.   Was in that car.   The entire United  States of America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) In the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed smiles at him and rests a gentle hand on his shoulde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave,  the country is sick.  And we're  gonna get it to a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at them for a moment then  smiles slightly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of gilt-edged doors swing open to reveal a massive bedroom beyond.   It is fifty-feet long and twenty-feet w Brocaded draperies hang from the windows and a four-poste bed stretches to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the living quarters.                         The President's bedroom is on                          this side and the First Lady's is over  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave walks forward in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) First Lady...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  You won't even see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave looks at him, puzzled.   Bob glances back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cluing him in) They barely talk anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens.  This is where you'll be  sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob flings open the door.   Dave enters the room and look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gawking) Holy cow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be back for you first thing  tomorrow and if you need me for  anything, Duane will be right outside  the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still stunned) Oh... Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks out into a "Presidential"  grin...

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: She stares straight INTO the CAMERA with "The Morning Sho set behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The White House now classifies the  President's condition as a `slight  circulatory problem of the head.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although technically a stroke, spokesmen  say the President's condition is far  from serious and he ought to be up and  around sometime soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA WIDENS OUT to reveal that the TV is in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first rays of sunrise are breaking through the window Reed Sits on the couch holding a large rubber ice bag whi Bob paces across the rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how many different kinds  of laws we've broken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) It's simple, Alan.  We send the Vice- President to Africa or something, dig  up some dirt on him, force him to resign  and get our `President' to nominate a  new one.  The whole thing takes a few  weeks tops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) You mean we get `Dave' to nominate you  as Vice President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a senator, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocently) Oh, I know. And then when our poor  President gets another stroke - - of  course much more serious this time - -  the newly appointed V.P. becomes the  Pres...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) What about containment, Alan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed heaves a sigh and looks at his notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the nurses for fifty grand a piece and the doctors for a hundred.   The older one wanted head of the CDC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) Is that everybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duane's guys, but he's got them under  control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her?... Oh -- the First Lady... (beat) She was giving that commencement speech  up in Bryn Mawr.  I managed to catch  her before she left the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evenly) I told her his blood pressure went up  after a little incident at  `the hotel.'   She seems to hate him more than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tossing down his legal  pad) Everybody else is buying the minor  stroke'  story...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) I just hope this yutz can pull it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave sits up on the examining table with his shirt off. Reed and three other vascular specialists watch attentive while the President's personal physician puts a stethosco to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowering it) Well, I must say, Mr. President, even  for a man with a mild stroke you seem  to have made a remarkable recovery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happy as a clam) Thanks.  I'm feeling much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed smiles like a proud father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at his chart) No signs of paralysis, no circulatory  changes.  Your E.M.G. is completely  normal and your blood pressure has  even gone down. (beat) Have you been exercising recently?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Just the usual..  Watching the diet --  A little weight lifting... Some power talking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob shoots him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding with the other  physicians) Well, judging from these tests,  I  don't see any reason why you couldn't  start back to work within a couple of  days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave looks at them and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave moves through the outer office flanked by Bob and Re He wears a blue Presidential jogging suit with a little g seal embroidered on the chest.  Dave approaches a line of SECRETARIES standing behind their desks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Now, remember -- keep it simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bangs into the side of a credenza. Bob and Reed freeze Dave gathers himself then keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking up to the first  one) Good morning, Clara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to second one...) Good morning, Diane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Randi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans forward, grasping his hand,  desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (welling with tears) Oh, good morning, Mr. President. I'm so relieved that you're alright.   You really had me scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave smiles and nods as she continues to clutch onto his Bob and Reed take him by the shoulders and move him insid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is still staring at the doorway as they close the door the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still pulling him) Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave glances back toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's just a little emotional -- she feels kind of attached to the  President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave nods as they deposit him in the President's chair. slides the phone in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's go over it again. You met  a girl, you fell in love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're going away for a holiday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing him the receiver) For a month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right and don't embellish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) I promise.  I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob slides the phone closer as he begins to dial the numb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice is sitting at her desk staring at a large rock on h finger.  She talks into the telephone, extending her hand the manner of all newly-engaged women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't believe it.  As soon as we  sit down he pulls out this ring... (beaming) ... Oh I know - -I just got so  emotional.  The waiter had to   bring  me another napkin.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RING.  A light indicating the second line starts blinking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on. (switching lines) Kovic Temps (beat) Dave!  Where are you? (pause) You met who?.., You're going where? (beat) Cancun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a longer pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's fine... No, I think it's  great.., Sure, I understand I will...  Okay... 'Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses for a moment then hits the first line all over again,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in love Thank God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sander Vanocur stands just outside the white House gates, filing his nightly report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President continued his  convalescence, resting in the white  House for the second straight day.   His personal physician pronounced him  in perfectly good health...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've examined him thoroughly and I  must say, I don't think I've ever seen  the President in better shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave's initial rinse is replaced with a professional dye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newly coiffed, Dave tries on a series of hand-tailored su hanging on a rack in the middle of his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed watches while Dave struggles vainly in the mirror wi his first set of contact lenses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President was able to attend to  Some official business on Wednesday,  and continues to be briefed on all  areas of national concern...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed stands in front of the desk Pointing to a large  organizational chart of government

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOINT CHIEFS-----THE CABINET-----N.S.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits at the President's spot in the middle of the cabi table.  Propped up in all the other chairs, are Poster-si photographs of the various cabinet members.  Bob points t one as Dave thinks for a moment, then guesses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares in wonder at a full, formal place-setting.  The are five forks, three knives and a countless number of sp Dave looks at it all, baffled for a moment, while Reed gu his hand toward the fish knife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So confident was the white House in  the President's recovery, that they  have just sent the Vice President on a  twelve nation African goodwill tour...  This is Sander Vanocur at the white House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave enters from the back of the room, flanked by Bob and Reed on either side.  They make their way down the aisle a large wooden podium with the "Seal of the President" on front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First thing we're gonna work on is the  mannerisms.  Alan has put together  sort of a training program

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lead him through the empty press chairs toward the f of the room.   Reed climbs up the short Steps that lead t the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now some of this may feel a bit Strange  at first.  You gotta remember that  even a professional Politician has  Some trouble getting used to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping) A teleprompter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave wanders forward staring in wonder at the clear glass panels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teleprompter.  Is it hooked up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He folds his arms in front of him turning to Bob and Reed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) As I was saying, no one expects you to  be Bill Mitchell overnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The important thing to remember is his general presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Now whenever he stands at a  Podium, the President always puts one  hand in the pocket of his coat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) At a press conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's at a press conference. Otherwise he just puts `em right out  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not certain about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure.  Remember the convention  speech?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave puts his hands on either side of the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a perfect Bill  Mitchell) 'An America stronger than the one we  were given.  An America prouder than  the one we found.' (turning to them) He has 'em right there on the side.

dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just dumped it on him instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks at him stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When does it break?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Couple of days. (showing him a folder) Anyhow, look at these tracking polls,  they'll burn up in your hands: seventy- three percent with seniors, eighty- four with working mothers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little uneasy) Alan, we still have to control this  guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) And look at this.  Russell came around  on the trade bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been waiting to pass  that thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, Bob,  it's a gift.   When you got a Ferrari you don't leave  it in the garage.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENTIAL MOTORCADE
dialogues.text: The long line of black limousines and police motorcycles its way through downtown Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave sits next to the First Lady in the back seat of the Both of them stare straight ahead.   Finally, after sever seconds of silence, Ellen turns to Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over at her, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) Since when do you care about the  homeless?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I care about the homeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I'm sure it's keeping you up  nights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away from him, twisting in the seat.  The botto Ellen's skirt hikes up her thigh, exposing the top part o her leg.  Dave looks down at it, drawn to the sight of na flesh.  Sensing something, Ellen glances back and catches looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes lock for a moment.  Dave  smiles quickly and glances out the  window.  Ellen looks down at her own  leg a little puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sidewalk is teeming with press.  The shelter itself i painted a bright shade of blue - - a cheery little island a sea of graffiti.  A small group of community leaders wa by the front door while the Presidential limousine pulls to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door pops open as Ellen and Dave step out.  He turns waves to the crowd while she stares straight ahead.  Reed hurries up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Okay, it's straight klick and smile  but there's a great visual in the  kitchen so make sure you stop at the  soup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shoots him a glare as they reach the top of the stair Dave nods and they move forward to greet the community le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a couple of steps inside, then suddenly stops. smile fades as his eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is more a nursery school than a homeless shelter.  Twe to thirty children, most of them black, stand formally  assembled in front of the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (good at this) One of the things they're trying to do  here at Helping Hand, is keep verbal  skills alive.  The first thing that  goes with these kids is their ability  to communicate and they need to get to  them before this happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances over her shoulder.  Dave has wandered forward the edge of the large rubber mat.  Everyone stares, stunn as he looks at the kids for a moment, then sinks suddenly his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Hi there.

dialogues.speaker: PRESS CORPS
dialogues.text: The cameras surge forward to the side of the play area. SHUTTERS FIRE WILDLY as Dave glances up at the cardboard outs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) You like cartoons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids don't respond.  They stare at the crush of repor and glancing TV lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning toward the  cameras) Could you just stop that for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone freezes.  The camera crews back up a step as Dav turns back toward the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softer) You like Tweety Bird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few of them nod.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: She stares in disbelief as her husband sits cross-legged the middle of the mat.  He leans forward, into the childr talking like a kindergarten teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, which one do you like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FOUR-YEAR-OLD tugs gently at his sleeve.  He wears dona overalls and a N.Y. Mets T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a lisp) Sylvester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Sylvester?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's a cat.

dialogues.speaker: REED
dialogues.text: He beams from ear to ear as the photo-op materializes in of his eyes. Dave glances over at him, cupping his hand i whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (side of his mouth) Gimme a quarter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick.  Gimme a quarter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed fishes through his pockets and comes up with a coin. moves to the mat, slipping it to Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning forward) Okay - - what can run all day without  getting tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid looks at him, baffled.  Dave reaches out slowly a taps the side of his nose.  DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not your ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lighting up) My nose?

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: She watches in amazement as her husband reaches out and  "magically" produces a quarter from the side of the child nose.  Dave looks up at her with a smile, and their eyes as a hundred shutters fire at once...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes a man rise to a particular  moment in history?  What makes a man  in the thicket of middle age, suddenly  rediscover himself with the wonder of  a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later on tonight, we'll talk with Dr.  Henry Mueller who is an expert in the  psychological effects of a mid-life  health crisis... and to Gail Sheehy,  who has just co-authored a book on  male menopause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a MAN HUMMING "Hail to the Chief" plays O.S. DAVE - Rev. 7/22/92                                  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steam billows up in the shower while Dave scrubs shampoo his hair.  He massages it vigorously into his scalp while humming continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Bum, bum da dum...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rinses it out and reaches for the soap.   It's a small soap on a rope" designed to look like the Presidential se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you'd do something  like that.  Not even you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the shower swings open as  Ellen materializes.  No queen of England  ever looked more regal than Ellen  Mitchell in her cloud of steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave jumps with a start, then turns away from her quickly bashfully facing the tile.   He looks back at Ellen over shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... How could I what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, Bill.  Don't patronize  me.   I'm not one of your little... (beat) Turn around.  I'm talking to you!...  Turnaround!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave steels himself then turns slowly around to face her. strikes a "stoic" pose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trembling slightly) ... You know, if you want to be the  same old bastard, that's fine.  I can  handle it.   But don't pull                             this 'man of the people' bullshit and  then do something like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frozen; feeling - very  exposed) I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated) That's not just a works bill you vetoed --  that would have given these kids  homes... (losing it a little) ... When I think about that little  spectacle you pulled with those muppets  and that magic trick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with a magic trick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made their funding disappear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave recoils a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.  If there was some mistake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a rage) There's no mistake, Bill.   If you  veto their funding, it's not a mistake.  If you hurt someone intentionally,  it's not a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and leaves through the steam disappearing as su as she came.  Dave hesitates for an instant, then starts after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duane is seated at his regular post when Ellen comes stal out of Dave's suite. He looks up in amazement as Dave run out a moment later.   He's dripping wet and clutching a b towel around his waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Duane) Call Bob and Reed.  Tell them I need  them immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's ten-thirty at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave turns and gives him a "Presidential" glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (backing off) Yeah, sure. You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave is seated at his desk, hair still wet, dressed in th Presidential jogging suit. The door bursts open.  It's Bo and Reed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Reed cross over toward the desk as Dave slams dow copy of rolled up newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at it) The Washington Post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pounding his finger on  the front page) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob glances at the paper then hands it to Reed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at it; shrugging) President vetoes works bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We vetoed that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a slow boil) No!...  WE didn't anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interceding) Dave, these things get awfully  complicated sometimes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That shelter was in this bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing it) Alan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of shelters were in this bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving toward him)) Listen, you little...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting in) Dave, the budget's a very complicated  thing.  Even I don't understand it  sometimes.  Now occasionally we have  to make some cuts and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we went there.  We saw those kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And if you can find a way to cut  THREE HUNDRED AND FIFTY MILLION DOLLARS  from the federal budget, then you can  keep your lousy shelters, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave just looks at him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small Ford Escort with a Thrifty rent-a-car sticker pul up to the East Gate of the White House.  It stops just sh of the guard station, then rolls forward a few feet and s again.

dialogues.speaker: MURRAY
dialogues.text: He leans out of the window, squinting into the sun.  Murr holds a mangled map of Washington in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified) I'm here to see... the President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard looks at him without responding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked me to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard reaches for the phone and dials a few numbers. Murray jiggles nervously in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits in the exact same chair that Dave occupied on his arrival.  Murray stares across the Oval Office with a ter look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent whisper) I'm serious, Dave -- you could get in  a lot of trouble for something like  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They could put you in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they do that.  They hired  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murray just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kind of a national emergency thing.    I can't really talk about it... (confidentially) Paying me big money too.   C'mere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads Murray from the chair to the other side of the d Dave reaches down opening the bottom drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See.

dialogues.speaker: DESK DRAWER
dialogues.text: It is full of money.   Neat little stacks of hundred doll bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at it wide-eyed,  frozen by  what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering; indicating  the walls) Are we being taped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is undeclared income.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who's gonna find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The government

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murray turns and looks at his best friend, speechless. stares at Dave for a couple of seconds when a strange loo wonder crosses his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know -- kind of wild, huh? (beat) Let's get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light is burning in the second floor residence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a large oak-lined room in the private residence. Dave and Murray sit on either side of a huge dining table with papers strewn all around them.   In front of Murray a large,  leather bound volume of the federal budget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta tell ya, Dave.  I've been going  over this a bunch of times and a lot  of this stuff just doesn't add up. (beat) Who does these books?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light is burning in the second floor residence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a large oak-lined room in the private residence.  D and Murray sit on either side of a huge dining table with papers strewn all around them.  In front of Murray sits a large, leather bound volume of the federal budget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta tell ya, Dave.  I've been going  over this a bunch of times and a lot  of this stuff just doesn't add up. (beat) Who does these books?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think they make this stuff a  lot more complicated than it has to  be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not surprised. (beat) Can we save anywhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah.  But you gotta start making  some choices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choices?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know -- priorities. (thinking) Remember when you couldn't get your  car fixed `cause you wanted to get  that piano?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopefully) You could buy it on payments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thumping the budget) Yeah.  That's how you end up with a  400 billion dollar deficit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's lots of places where I  think you can save, but I'm not the  one who's ....... I mean, I'm not the  one who's not the Pres...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) It's alright.  I know what you mean.   Let's start at the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is jammed to capacity. The CABINET SECRETARIES are seated around the table while White House staff lines the walls.   Three television cre are poised in the far corner of the room.

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Reed enters and crosses to Dave's regular spot at the cab table.   He places a stack of 3 x 5 filing cards next to water glass and retreats to his seat along the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob moves down the corridor with a little spring in his s He is actually whistling a cheery tune as he carries the  morning edition of the Washington Post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob enters with a great big grin and even says hello to C couple of aides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob sits down next to Reed unfolding a  copy of the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Its a work of art.  Look at this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed glances down at the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads softly) `Vice President's office linked to  First Liberty scandal. Justice  Department may investigate.' (beat) Alan, you're a genius -- we're on our  way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks up and glances around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) What's with the cameras?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundredth cabinet meeting.  I thought  it was a nice touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (benignly) Oh.  Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave enters suddenly, moving quickly  into the room.  He nods to the various  staff members, crossing to his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave takes a stack of index cards from his own pocket and places them next to Reed's.  He leans forward, clearing h throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (purposefully) Before we get started today there are  a few things I'd like to go over in  the budget.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: He glances up from his report and leans over to Reed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Do we have anything on the budget today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look slowly toward the table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clutches one of the 3 x 5 cards in  his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I think I've found some ways to  put back the homeless section of the  Simpson Garner works bill.

dialogues.speaker: CABINET TABLE
dialogues.text: A slight murmur moves through the Cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing up) Uh, Mr. President... I don't believe  that's on your agenda today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleasantly) Well it's a last minute change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob goes completely white as Dave turns back to the Cabin table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way I see it we need three hundred  and fifty million dollars in order to  keep the program.   Now some of this  can be achieved through some simple  changes in cash management.  For  example...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans forward onto the table, reading from his card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the O.M.B. we have  seventeen defense contractors who are  delinquent in their contracts. (scanning the table) Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... I believe so...  Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So even though they're late, we keep  paying them on time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- in a sense... yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now instead of giving them money for  something they haven't finished, we  could hold back that cash, put it aside  in some interest bearing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaping suddenly to  his feet) Mr. President!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: He turns slowly around in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (daring him) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Dave, then out into the room.  Twelve Cabinet Secretaries, the White House staff and three network TV c are focused right at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands there, frozen in the glare of the TV lights.  B looks at them for a moment then sinks slowly into his sea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tightly) .. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling quietly) Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to the table clutching the card in his hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I was saying, if we took that  cash and stuck it in even an ordinary  savings account,  we'd be making twelve  million a month in interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A murmur goes around the table.  The SECRETARY OF THE TRE shifts a little in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, technically that's true...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks about it for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Yes, I suppose that's true.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: He has taken a handful of curtain and twisted it uncon-  sciously into a rope.  Reed stares straight ahead, stunne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But unfortunately, money management  only gets us halfway to our goal.  To  find the rest of the money, we're going  to have to start making some choices - -  some pretty tough choices...

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: He seizes Reed's tie, pulling him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) Choices???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hearing him) Yes, Bob.   Choices... Now the                           Commerce Department..,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting erect) Yes, Mr. President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from a card) You're spending forty-three million  dollars on an ad campaign to... (reading) 'Boost consumer confidence in the  American auto industry.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's proving quite effective...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it make the cars any better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No,  sir.  It's more of a perceptual  issue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Perceptual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's designed to bolster individual  confidence in a previous domestic  automotive purchase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... to shore up product  identification and preserve market  share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we're spending forty-seven million  dollars to make people feel better  about a car they've already bought?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but I wouldn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indignant) Well I'm sure that's really important,    but I don't want to tell some eight- year-old kid he has to sleep in the  street because we want people to feel  better about their cars. (beat) Do you want to tell him that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures toward the TV cameras in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?   Uh, no sir... I sure don't.

dialogues.text: Bob fumes at this but a slight smile actually starts to c up the side of Reed's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out a pen and jots down a  figure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  That gives us another forty- seven million.   Now the Postal  Service...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting up) Yes, Mr. President!
