dialogues.text: Dave's tie is loosened at his throat and there are notes out around him. The Cabinet leans forward in their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so that makes... (whispering) ... Two, eighty-four, carry the three... (pause) ... Three hundred and fifty-six million. (looking up with a smile) ... And that means we can keep the  program.

dialogues.speaker: CABINET ROOM
dialogues.text: The entire room bursts into applause. Bob fumes silently his spot along the wall as the ovation continues around h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the cabinet room bursts open as the mob pours into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful job, sir... Fantastic, Mr.  President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave moves down the corridor followed by the throng.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob stands very still in the center of the empty room.  R blocks the door a few feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) I'm going to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't kill a President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks at him for a moment, then suddenly explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a President! He's an ordinary  person.  I can kill an ordinary person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can kill a HUNDRED ordinary people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's only doing what you told him to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) What I told him to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you.  You said 'cut three  hundred million dollars from the federal  budget, and you can keep your homeless  shelter.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't mean it, Alan. Why the  fuck would I want to save a homeless  shelter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was only doing his job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks at him for a moment then erupts all over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His job? His job!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lunges for the door while Reed grabs him around the wa DAVE - Rev. 6/9/92                                  78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not his job -- It's my job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrashing around) Was he a senator? Is he on the  Trilateral Commission? Was he in Who's  Who In Washington NINE YEARS Reed  wrestles him away from the door, as  Bob struggles to get free.  I'll destroy  him, Alan. I'll shred the bastard!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll lock him away for good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll all go to jail together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob stops struggling suddenly and backs up a step. His ey narrow to tiny slits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean by that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smoothing out his suit) Just what you think I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Are you threatening me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking about it) Sort of... Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob looks at him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen is in a meeting with a few people when a MALE AIDE through the door handing her the afternoon paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: USA TODAY
dialogues.text: The large banner headline stretches across the top of the page, which reads: "PRESIDENT SAVES HOMELESS PLAN.  MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing) `Saves homeless plan'?

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: She stares at it stunned for a moment,  then lowers the p and looks off into space...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murray and Dave stand beside the Thrifty rent-a-car as th sun begins to dip behind the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. You did great.  Maybe later  you could come back and we could go to  Camp David or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (climbing in) That'd be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his friend) Well -- take care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murray FIRES UP the ENGINE as Dave steps back from the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking back) Yeah.  Don't get into trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the car into gear and starts  down the long, bending driveway toward  the gate.  Dave watches from the edge  of the lawn with a fond look on his  face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duane and Dave are seated across the card table from one  another.   Duane's shoulder holster is slung over the bac the chair.   They are drinking beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lays down his cards, fanning them out in front of Dave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimacing) I was waiting for that jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duane Scoops UP the cards and begins to Shuffle. Duane?       DAVE Yeah?        DUANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you went along with all of  this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duane Stops Shuffling and Stares at him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean with you and everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) `Bleed for your king.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First thing they teach you at the  academy. (remembering their motto) `Don't give me gold and silver, or  other worldly things, just the pride  and glory of bleeding for my King.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... They don't kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave nods solemnly as Duane stares straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Bill was your king, not Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but Bob found me when I was stuck  in Firearms and Tobacco...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks) We're trained to be loyal.  You gotta  be loyal to someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit for a moment in silence.   Duane checks his watc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't mean to bum you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.  You alright down here by  yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure.  Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods and heads for the door as Dave picks up the cards He begins to deal out some solitaire,  then senses someth and looks toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen stands silhouetted in the doorway wearing a floor- dressing gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Ellen walks forward into the light, tightening the belt a her waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... . Ellen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the light.  I thought maybe you  were up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Oh... Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I sit down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scoops up the cards trying to tidy some of the bottles She studies his face for a couple of seconds then sits do at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was quite a thing you did today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody would have done it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't think so. (staring at him) Still, you helped a lot of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues to stare as Dave looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of reminds me of that thing you  did back in the state legislature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? (nervous) Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't in the state legislature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave freezes with the deck in his hand.    All at once, E smiles and extends her arm over the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Ellen Mitchell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes go wide.  Dave sits stunned trying his best to  swallow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave stares at her, but no words come out.   She leans fo looking right at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evenly) Look, I'll make this easy on you.  I  never see him anymore.  I barely know  him anymore.  I'd just kinda like to.  know where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave looks at her, nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, what is it?  Another Secretary?   A jaunt to the Bahamas with Some  'campaign worker.'  Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, waiting for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, Ellen and Duane stare straight ahead as they descen into the sub-basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I really shouldn't be doing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one replies as the elevator doors slide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone Secret Service man is stationed outside a solid me door as the three of them approach - - Duane hesitates an looks at Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) Open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duane looks back at the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just open it, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open as a middle-aged woman in a white un appears.  Even in the dim light of the hallway it's clear is a NURSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, you're not allowed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flashing an I.D.) It's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Alexander left strict...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before she can even finish Ellen steps quickly by her int the room.  The Nurse recognizes her and just gapes as Dua and Dave enter as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dimly lit like the hallway, except for a group of  machines in the corner.  Next to them, a state-of-the-art hospital bed holds the President's lifeless body.  Ellen up to the side of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the stroke.  It's pretty bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. Is he,  I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a pause.  The Nurse looks down.   Ellen clutches railings of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All at once she starts to cry.  Dave moves over to try to comfort her when she shakes him off violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave recoils.   She turns to him with an enraged look in eye.   He moves back a step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) When were you all planning to                        tell me? A year from now?   After the  election... (whirling on him) What's going on here?                                Dave hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They asked me to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure they did.  'State of  Emergency.'  'National Security.' You  ever hear of the Constitution?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't respond.  Ellen glares at him for a moment, th glances around the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could all of you just leave me alone  for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really not supposed to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave motions toward Duane as the two of them guide the nu into the hallway.  They shut the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: She stares down at the lifeless body while the sound of t RESPIRATOR fills the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suitcases are flung open and she kneels on the floor.  El throws piles of clothing into the large open valise when senses something and glances up..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave is standing in the doorway.  She looks at him for a  moment, but goes right back to packing.  He stands in the doorway, staring while she crams some shoes in the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clipped) I'm not the First Lady, anymore.  I  shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs a blouse from the bed and flings t into the sui

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up) Oh, they didn't brief you on that?   How sloppy of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Dave and stops.  All at once Ellen stops pac and lowers a shoe to her side.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ANGLE
dialogues.text: Dave stands in the doorway with a small valise in his han He looks like he did a month ago, with the tortoise shell glasses and his old blue windbreaker. The valise is a tin overnight bag with small black handles.  A seal of the  President embossed into the leather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Just souvenirs.  Towels and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) You1re leaving, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) I never wanted to hurt anybody. (beat) In fact... I even thought I was helping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen just looks at him for a moment.  Her mouth opens sl but no words come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... It's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen is crying.  She shakes her head  and turns away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave unzips the valise and fishes out a hanky.  The  Presidential Seal is nicely embroidered in one corner.  E looks down at it and smiles slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you make this little deal with yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can put up with the other women  and you can do without a life because  you believe in what you're doing - -  and if you can just keep your mouth  shut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought you had a chance to help  people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes lock for an instant when she turns and goes ba to packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) How were you gonna get home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I hadn't thought it out  that far.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: He looks at her for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave carries Ellen's suitcase in one hand and his own val in the other.  They step over the puddles and leaky water pipes as they duck below the six-foot ceiling.  Dave carr a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure this goes somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truman used it all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave pauses and shines the light up a leaky old set of st that head off to their right.  Ellen hesitates for a mome looking up the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to keep walking with  me.   I'm okay from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at him) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen hesitates for a second, then hikes up her skirt and moves through the portal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is directly across the street from the White House.  A lone street lamp illuminates the corner including a small recessed alcove where a staircase leads up from below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave and Ellen emerge stepping out  onto the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duane said he'd leave the car over  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads Ellen around a corner where a small brown Plymou sits parked at the curb. Dave fishes through his pockets pulls out the car keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing them to her) Here you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen looks down at the car keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he'll pick it up in a couple  of days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances at the Plymouth then back a Dave.  She just s at him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) It's just so strange...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave looks at her.  Ellen takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lock at you and I see Bill... (turning to him) I mean, he's almost dead, but he's  right here... I mean, you're right  here... alive and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not Bill Mitchell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact,  I'm not anything like him  and... I guess I want you to know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) He wasn't always like that, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes lock for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling a little) I'm starving.   There's got to be  something open around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen stares at him for a moment,  then finally smiles...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 7-11
dialogues.text: It is a twenty-four-hour convenience store.   Even at two the morning, several cars are parked in the lot. Ellen sits on the passenger side of Plymouth with her doo locked.   Dave emerges carrying a brown paper bag. He pops the driver's side door and hops inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really don't have much of an appetite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking over at her) Just wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He FIRES UP the CAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monuments are illuminated a glittering white.  The Li Memorial and Capitol Dome stand out against the long fiel grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eating Dave's "special  sandwich") This is good.  What's in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit side by side on a raised, grassy mound at the ba of the Washington Monument.   A large bath towel is sprea out between them with the Presidential Seal at the center Dave's bag is opened at their side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking another bite) You have a lot of secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you know?... About me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the way to the homeless shelter.   You looked at my leg. (pause) Bill lost interest a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.  I was worried it was the  shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.  They are perched on a small hill overlooking White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you do the rest of the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) You mean when I'm not running the country?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I run a temp agency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, secretaries and stiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) You find people jobs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Is that funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just more than anybody else does  around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well don't get carried away -- I'm not that good at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and studies him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly personal) And your family?   I assume you're  married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to her.   A couple of seconds go by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was... once. (pause) It didn't take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen laughs and looks out over the mall.    Dave takes a swig of his soda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) You know, Dave -- it is Dave, isn't  it?  I can't keep all of this a secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you could go to jail for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and looks at her.    There doesn't seem to be an fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen turns and studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked doing it,  though.  Not the  fancy stuff with the helicopter or the  TV cameras but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen keeps staring at him.    Dave glances back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked saving that shelter.  I liked  helping people I hadn't even met before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet for a moment.    He stares back at the White H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) And right then I felt like I wasn't  pretending anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several seconds go by.   Dave stares off at the White Hou across the mall while Ellen studies his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you were pretending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave turns to her as their eyes lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked being married to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen turns all the way around on the blanket staring at from less than a foot away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do if you were still in  there?  If you had one more chance to  be President, what would you do then?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: He stares at her for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Lots of things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small brown Plymouth rolls up to the guard ate as the uniformed officer leans out of his booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir.  There's no visitors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave rolls down his window, showing his Presidential face the Guard,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping to) Mr. President!  I'm sorry I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just getting some air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly, sir... How did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen leans across him toward the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidentially) The President wanted some ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard snaps off a crisp salute as Dave casually retur it.  The gate raises in front of them as he steps on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave and Ellen stand at the top of the long staircase tha leads to the living quarters. Ellen looks up at him for a moment, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) ... You make a nice President, Dave  Kovic.. . go for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen looks him in the eye for a moment, then turns and h off toward her suite.  Dave stands there watching her rec down the hall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone gardener rides his lawn mower across the lawn...

dialogues.speaker: WHITE HOUSE BRIEFING ROOM
dialogues.text: It is jammed full of the White House Press Corps.   A hun or so REPORTERS mill about while they wait for the start press conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet it's that Fidelity thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think they're gonna ditch the Veep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first guy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confident) He's finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all nod together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob moves down the corridor with his briefcase in his C h He glances up and notices action from the briefing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) What the hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a man desperately containing a SCREAM ECHOES THROUGH the public rooms on the first floor.    Bob comes sprinting into the large open receiving room, taking out of the little rope stanchions that guide the visiting tou through.   He keeps on running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed glances up from his desk as Bob charges into the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) I didn't call it.   He called it  himself...  I swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob just looks at him, then turns and bolts into the hall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small group of tourists stands in the large marble entr They stare up at the staircase while their TOUR GUIDE des some of the artwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Jackson is the figure that you see  represented in the lower left hand... (beat; awed) Why there's Bob Alexander our White  House Chief of Staff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes careening into the foyer,    skittering across the polished marble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... My, he seems to be in quite a  hurry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave sits on the couch, jotting some notes on a legal pad The door swings open behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocently) You mean the press conference? (beat) I have a couple of ideas I wanted to  share with the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Share...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave rises from the couch as Bob moves  over to him with his eyes blazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't call a press conference.  I  call a press conference!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave just stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're nothing.  Do you understand me!   You're NOBODY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly) I'm... not... nobody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lint!  You're a flea!  You're a  blip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I am.  But you're fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob backs up a step and stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said you're fired.  Go on -- get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob just looks at him, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... I'm fired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops and stares at Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fine) Fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Fine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses to the door of the Oval Office and flings it o wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the whole Press Corps out there.    Why don't you just go tell 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob's eyes narrow a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.   Be my guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other for a long  moment.    Neither man moves as they  stand toe to toe in the center of the  carpet.   For a second,  it isn't clear  who's going to win, until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen comes over and takes his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Audrey Hepburn) Darling, they're all waiting for you  in the Press Room - - you've really  got to get going... (as if seeing him for  the first time) Oh, Bob... (back to Dave) I'm sorry, darling.   I thought you were alone - -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen turns toward Bob with a sudden grin.   His expressi falls visibly as the weight of their alliance becomes cle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like your resignation on my desk  by the time I get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at them stunned and defeated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is packed to capacity.  Dave stands alone at the podiu while the press corps crowds every inch of the Briefing R He stares squarely into the cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming on such short notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed stands off to the side with an  almost mesmerized look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, I'd like to announce something  that might come as a surprise to many  of you. (beat) I've asked Bob Alexander to resign as  White House Chief of Staff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A murmur goes through the Press Room.   Dave looks straig ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes,  two people just change and  it's better for everybody if they go  their Own way. (beat) Over the last few months!  Bob and I  have come to believe in different  things.   He thinks this country is  fine and we should go about doing  business as usual. (beat) I just don't feel that way.    Not  anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because things aren't fine.    And you  know that and I know that.  And we can  keep lying to ourselves, but it's a  little late for that. (getting angry) We've got water we can't drink and air  we can't breathe.   We've got bars on.  our windows and graffiti on our doors.     If you get sick you can't afford to go  to the doctor and if you get laid off  you can't find a new job.  We're  trillions of dollar in debt.  Our roads  are cracking, our bridges are crumbling  and everything we used to build is  made in Japan.  We've got people  sleeping in cardboard boxes,  and ten- year-old kids who are doing drugs.   We've been living together for four  hundred years, and we're still trying  to kill each other...  But that isn't  even the worst part.  The worst part  is we feel like we can't do anything  about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks out over the room and pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I've decided that while I'm  President,  I should actually try to  do things... even if they seem  impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave glances toward the wings for a moment and turns back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First off I'm initiating a program to  try to find a decent job for every  American who wants one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A murmur moves through the press room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hearing them) Why start here? (pause) Because if you've ever seen the look  on someone's face the day they get a  job -- I've had some personal experience  with this - - they look like they could  fly.  And unless we start tapping into  that kind of spirit again, there's no  way we're gonna fix anything in this  country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks out at them and pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... Let's get to work.

dialogues.speaker: BRIEFING
dialogues.text: The press corps just sits stunned for a moment as Dave st off the stage.  As he leaves, the stunned reporters explo to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Mr. President... Mr. President...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave enters the corridor and sees Ellen, who is waiting f him with a huge look of admiration on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beaming) It was inspirational.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the boldest initiative yet of the  `New Bill Mitchell' presidency, the  President has proposed a comprehensive  full employment program, unparalleled  since the days of F.D.R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  It's naive, it's dangerous, it's  irresponsible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  It's courageous, it's challenging,  it's visionary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRED BARNES (MacGLAUGHLIN GROUP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN McLAUGHLIN ("CROSSFIRE")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the President wants to run around  proposing lame-brained schemes like  this one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he's certainly got my vote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TELEVISION SUDDENLY SWITCHES OFF as the CAMERA WIDENS to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, slumping back from the TV into an armchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, Ellen, Reed, Ellen's Aide, and two other advisors a camped in front of the television set.  There are documen and newspapers scattered over the room.  A take-out pizza sits incongruously on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's call it a night.   I can't take  any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  We can pick up on the rest  tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone starts to get up, gathering their papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving toward                           the door) I'll have those employment figures to  you by eight-thirty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we've got that labor briefing at  nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bleary eyed) Terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone starts to move through the door, leaving Dave an Ellen suddenly alone.  They are standing face to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I guess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Bedtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their faces are very close.  Their eyes express great nee He moves slowly toward her in a kiss.  Their lips meet fo instant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling back) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) I know. I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I want to... I just, I feel  strange...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (even quicker) That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand there facing one another like two kids on a fr porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lies under the covers staring at the ceiling. Dave sud turns and punches the pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lies on her bed in exactly the same position. After a moment, Ellen turns and buries her face in the pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled) This is crazy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave and Duane move down the corridor that leads to the O Office.  Duane is flipping through a handful of newspaper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The U.S. News hammered us.  But they're  always tough on that kind of thing.   Rosenthal loved us in the Times

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, Mr. Nance is waiting  inside for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freezing) The Vice-President...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... right... (to Randi, nervous  smile) You know, ever since the stroke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave points to his temple and gives the "wobbly" sign wit his hand.   He glances at Duane for a second, then turns heads inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated, with his back to the door, is the silhouette of a man holding an eight-foot spear.  Beside him on the floor a large ceremonial headdress.  Dave moves forward cautiou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vice President turns and slowly rises to face him.  H a strong-looking man in a plain gray suit with an honest  looking face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men shake hands.  Nance continues to stare at him while Dave moves toward his chair.  After a moment, Nance extends the headdress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (curtly) This is from the people of Burundi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking it) Oh... Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And these are a gift from the King  of To go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nance hands him what appears to be a group of large neckl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) What are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) Fertility beads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets them quickly on the desk while Nance just stares him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, may I speak frankly  with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hesitates for a moment.   Nance  gathers his thoughts,then proceeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with dignity) I know we haven't always gotten along.   I know we've disagreed politically  and I suppose I know what you think  of me personally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nance takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... But I've always tried to respect  the role you wanted me to play.    When I've disagreed with this  administration I've kept it to myself.    When you wanted my support you always  had it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave nods, frozen in his chair.  Nance looks at him a mom then suddenly lets it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, Bill -- how could you do  something like this to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave just looks at him speechless.  Neither man moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Something like what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, we're not children.  I  didn't have anything to do with this  Fidelity nonsense and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) The Fidelity nonsense...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (showing him a newspaper) All I've got is my integrity.  That's  all I have.  Now I don't know why you  turned your attack dogs on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) They re not my attack dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just fired Bob Alexander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nance looks at him, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  I'll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits behind his sleek Italian desk with a slightly she look on his face. Dave stands across from him, leaning on feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean you made it all up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had to, Dave. The guy's a choir  boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is wrong, Alan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like a novel, new  concept) Wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know, I know... It looks                      awfully bad.  It's really embarrassing.   (beat) But it was Bob's idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave looks at him horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to fix this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.  Well, that might be kind  of tough. Once the press starts smelling  blood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door blows open behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flies into the room with a worried  look on her face.  Dave and Reed watch  while she heads toward the "media  center" in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) `Dave'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen flicks ON the SET to catch a NEWS REPORT in mid-seg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over TV) ... The hastily called news conference  at the National Press Club was Bob  Alexander's first public comment  since resigning as White House Chief  of Staff.  It turned out to be nothing  short of a full-fledged salvo fired  directly at Pennsylvania Avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob appears in a film clip, speaking before the National  Press Club.   Even beneath the professional cool, he seem to relish the lethal sound bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over TV) When I first began to look into the  allegations concerning Fidelity  Savings and Loan, I thought the  wrongdoing was restricted to the  Vice President's office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They glance at each other then back at the set...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over TV) ... But as I began to investigate, I  realized that this pattern of  corruption extended much higher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob pauses for an effect, then looks  straight into the camera:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over TV; dramatic) ... I was saddened to discover at  least fifteen separate acts of  intervention by this administration,  most with the full knowledge of the  President and all of them illegal.   Federal regulators were influenced,  records were destroyed, and pressure  was brought to bear, in same cases  by President Mitchell himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Now he's making stuff up about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn and look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighing) He's not making it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave stares at him stunned.   Ellen gets it immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Bob never left Bill's side.  He knows  where all the old bones are buried...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave glances back and forth between them but neither one them speaks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long line of black sedans with congressional plates pul up to the South Portico.   In the distance, beyond the fe a crowd of protesters shout at the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small delegation of congressional leaders has requested lunch with the President.  Reed and Ellen are also presen The SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE leans forward over his plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a Southerner) Mr. President, I don't know another  way to put it, but 'This dawg just  won't hunt.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave just stares at him without responding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We may be able to hold off this First  Liberty thing for a little while1 but  if you go running around the country  with this new jobs idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna put us on a spit an'   bring in the sauce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you just waited for a little while...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to wait for a little while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, I understand that.  But  sometimes ya fight an' sometimes ya  run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) That's not what you said during your  ethics investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every eye in the room turns toward  her.  The Speaker stares daggers across  the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you needed the President's help,  you got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (controlled) Ma'am, no one appreciates your husband's  help more'n me.   I'm just saying that  this jobs thing is a little unwieldy...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chiming in) It is not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every eye shifts to the Vice President. Ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's lots of ways to make it work.   You could have targeted tax credits  for on-site training...  You could  have a public private partnership like - J.T.P.A...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me for interruptin' but this  ain't some city council silliness that's  gonna blow over.  We're talking about  obstructing federal regulators and  violating election up on the Hill who  are talkin' impeachment. We got a real  problem on our hands.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: He just stares straight ahead...

dialogues.speaker: BOB ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: It is a video clip from his lethal press conference.  Bob faces the camera directly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... At least fifteen separate acts  of intervention by this  administration, most with full  knowledge of the President..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess they're coming at you now,  too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave sits in front of his bookcase with a remote control his hand.   He turns to see the Vice President, standing the edge of the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at the screen) Dirty business we're in sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not gonna win -- not in the  end... They never do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sometimes they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Yeah... Sometimes they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nance shifts a little by the bookcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, whatever happens I  just wanted you to know that I think  that your jobs program is a wonderful  idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that anyone's gonna pay much  attention now... But thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither one says anything.  Dave motions to a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to sit down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a seat across from the desk.   Nance glances ove at the TV as both men look at the freeze frame of Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever think back to how you  started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know.  Your first campaign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever think back to how you did it all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... (thinks about it for a  moment...) .. I was a shoe salesman. (beat) and not very happy about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile together for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day my wife says to me 'Why don't  you try running for office.  You talk  about it all the time, why don't you  just do it?' (beat) So I tell my boss I have a dentist  appointment and I go down to the  registrar of voters on my lunch break. (shakes his head) Next thing I know, I'm a councilman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) My wife was my campaign manager. We  had a two thousand dollar budget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With advertising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave just looks at him for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get started?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Oh... Kinda the same way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave walks alone down the long pergola that flanks the Ro Garden.  He moves slowly, lost in thought, when he glance and suddenly, stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the roses are shimmering in the late afternoon light. Dave looks at them for a second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA MOVES WITH Dave as he heads down the long corr toward Ellen's side of the living quarters.  He holds a l yellow rose in his hand.  Dave pauses in front of her doo knocks and waits for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave steps inside the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a lively room, especially for the White House.  Acro the room one of the French doors is open wide.  The curta billow out to the terrace beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave steps outside, and looks around.  It's a beautiful, night. The Washington Monument soars in the distance with Jefferson Memorial just a speck beyond.  Dave hears SOMET in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rounds the corner to find Ellen standing all alone by edge of the balustrade. He moves quietly up toward the ra as she turns and looks at him.  He extends the rose, hold it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reserved) ... Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only half a smile.   He moves closer and pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a pause) Looks like we're not going to get a  chance to get much done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave thinks about it and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softer) They're crucifying you out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but we got a little bit done.   And if you do a little and I do a  little... then maybe the next                        guy'll do a little...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really believe that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (pauses, quieter) And it's better than not believing it  Their faces are inches apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) I sure fall for some weird guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, almost imperceptibly, they come together in a kis It's soft and tender at first -- then builds in passion a need. A lone CHURCH BELL from the National Cathedral starts CHI at midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave and Ellen part, drawn by the sound.  After a moment, Dave looks slowly back at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Nance is a good man, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just looks at him.   It's a strange expression -- par sadness, part fear, part intrigue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallowing) Yeah.   He's a good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off her look) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head.   He touches the side of her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just getting to know you -- I don't  want to lose you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come together and kiss again.  Even with everything unsaid, there's a sadness in the air. WIDENING OUT... Two small figures cling onto each other by the third floo balustrade of the White House...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gleams in the sunshine.

dialogues.speaker: SANDER VANOCUR
dialogues.text: She stands in front of the Great Rotunda, doing a live in for "NBC News"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President has requested this rare  joint session of Congress so that he  could personally answer the allegations  raised by Bob Alexander, his former  Chief of Staff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is packed to capacity with the House members on one si and the Senate on the other.  There is great tension on b sides of the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several long black limos deposit occupants in front of Bo Alexander's townhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob stands in a cardigan sweater holding a tumbler full o bourbon while his cocktail party is going full swing.  Se inside the beltway fat cats mill about the living room wh Vanocur continues on the TV:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speculation on the President's response  has run the gamut from a full-fledged  denial right up to the possibility  that he might resign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are hoots and hollers in the room.  One of the GUES raises a glass in salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bob) Here's to you, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another guest holds up a bumper sticker with "ALEXANDER F PRESIDENT" printed in large block letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (displaying it) What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's wait for the speech first. (false humility) Don't want to get ahead of ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: she sits tensely in front of her television...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tension in the room builds as everyone awaits the arr of the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH a crack in the doorway, most of the House Chamber visible.  The CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal: Dave and Reed, standing alone in the small ante-room.  There is a plain, black briefcase sitting between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything clear with Duane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed nods and hands him the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is all of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave tries to take briefcase but Reed keeps holding onto out of reflex and self-preservation.  Dave smiles at him gently starts to unpry Reed's fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Alan... Enjoy the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reed looks at him and tries to nod...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stands at their seats when the SERGEANT AT ARMS down the aisle, pounding a six-foot staff three times on House floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Speaker... The President of the  United States.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The response is more of a murmur than  the usual applause.  Dave appears at  the back of the Chamber carrying the  black briefcase.   He makes his way up  the aisle and mounts the five steps  that lead to the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches the lectern and glances  behind him.  Dave locks eyes with Vice  President Nance for a moment,  flashing  him a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a Superbowl party.   All of Bob's cronies h gathered around the TV set to watch "Bill Mitchell's" pol demise.  A huge grin spreads across Bob's face when Dave' image appears on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh shh... Here it comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave swallows once and grips the lectern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (pause) I wish I could be here today under  different circumstances...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hesitates for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's certainly a lot of things about  this country that we should be  discussing, but I realize that's not  possible now. (beat) As all of you know, my former Chief of  Staff has implicated me in a scandal  involving Fidelity Savings and Loan.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSE
dialogues.text: Every member sits motionless at their seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And once people start talking about  scandal it's hard for them to talk  about anything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scans the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So fine.   Let's talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches riveted from the edge of her bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over TV) Bob Alexander has accused me of... (pulls some notes out  of his pocket) Let me read this to make sure I get it  right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at his notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .... Illegally influencing government  regulators on behalf of major campaign  contributors -- interfering with an  ongoing Justice Department investigation - -  and violating Federal election laws in  the area of campaign finance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't a sound in the Chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- let's get right to the guts of  it...  Each one of these charges is  absolutely true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet but shocked murmur rolls through the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "war hoop" goes up from the guests. Bob almost seems to levitate off the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Die, you pond scum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the President and as they say 'The  buck stops here.'  So I take full  responsibility for every one of my  illegal acts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hoists the black briefcase up onto the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you see that's not the whole story,  and I think each one of you is entitled  to the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave opens the black briefcase to reveal a large stack of documents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have written proof here in the form  of... (reading) Notes, memoranda and personal  directives' proving that Bob Alexander  was involved in each one of these  incidents and in most cases planned  them as well...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: There is silence in the room.   All the color drains from face as Bob stares frozen at the television set.    The o in the room watch with the morbid fascination of someone  witnessing a car wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost a gasp) Alan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the guests furtively slides his Presidential bumpe sticker behind the onion dip.

dialogues.speaker: REED
dialogues.text: He stares out at the House Chamber feeling downright "mor He looks like someone who has just saved a puppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now - - allegations of wrong-doing  have also been made against Vice  President Nance... (pause) I'm afraid that's just a lie.

dialogues.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: He sits motionless in the chair feeling the weight of eve eye in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... As this evidence will show...  At  no time and in no way was Vice President  Nance involved in any of this affair.   Bob made all of that up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave turns and smiles at Nance for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: PODIUM
dialogues.text: Dave turns back toward the House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vice president Nance is a good and  decent public servant and I'd like to  apologize for any pain this may have  caused him or his family. (pause) And while we're setting the record  straight, I'd also like to apologize  to the American people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right INTO CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I forgot that I was hired to do a  job for you and that it was just a  temp job at that. I forgot that I had  two hundred and fifty million people  who were paying me to make their lives  a little better and I didn't live up  to my part of the bargain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, there are certain things you should  expect from a President.  I ought to  care more about you than I do about  me... I ought to care more about what's  right than I do about what's popular...

dialogues.speaker: HOUSE CHAMBER
dialogues.text: They sit motionless in their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ought to be willing to give this  whole thing up for something I believe  in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sad but proud smile starts around the corners of her mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on her TV) Because if I'm not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave clutches the sides of the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave stops in mid-sentence.  He raises his hand to his fo and seems to rock a moment.  A concerned murmur runs thro the floor of the House.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: He clutches the lectern now with a "woozy" look on his fa He "fights to stand up."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm not... Then I don't belong here  in the first place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All at once, Dave falls to the floor.    Duane and Reed a several Senate pages suddenly rush out to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is complete pandemonium.    Several members crowd arou the podium.    The NOISE LEVEL literally turns into a ROA Reed yanks at Dave's shirt and loosens his tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A doctor!  We need a doctor...  He's  had a stroke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up from the bed, grabs her overcoat and heads fo the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge crowd of Congressmen crowd around the platform.  T is complete confusion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The standard issue ambulance that follows the President I everywhere is parked just outside the House doors.  The d of the vehicle fly open as a doctor and nurse emerge.  Th the same two people who cared for Bill Mitchell at the ou of the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes a split second for them to whisk out the gurney and slam the doors behind them.  They bolt toward the Hou chamber while the Secret Service stands guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duane and other Secret Servicemen move the onlookers back the medical team loads Dave onto the gurney bed and hurry toward the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge a moment or two later with Duane leading the Dave has been securely fastened to the rolling stretcher the doctor and nurse hover close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pop the door of the ambulance.  A  crowd of onlookers watches in horror  as the body of the President is whisked  into the ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: MOTORCADE
dialogues.text: It tears away from the Capitol with dozens of SIRENS BLAR The ambulance is surrounded front and back by twenty poli motorcycles and the entire entourage takes off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is pandemonium here as well.  A huge stat team waits f the AMBULANCE as it comes SCREAMING up to the emergency  entrance at the back of the hospital.  They fling the doo of the ambulance open as they remove the near S lifeless of the President...

dialogues.speaker: GURNEY
dialogues.text: MOVING WITH it.  The Secret Service pushes back the mob o photographers as the doctors whisk the stretcher toward t hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duane sits quietly behind the wheel, while the commotion  continues behind the vehicle... THE CAMERA PANS SLOWLY OVER to the passenger's side, REVE

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: He sits in a white paramedics outfit complete with hat an name plate.  Dave is wearing his glasses once again and l decidedly unpresidential.   He glances over at Duane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you don't want a lift back  home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.  It's not that far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men shake hands and Dave reaches for the door.  H holds the same souvenir bag he had on his evening out wit Ellen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses and looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moved) I would have taken a bullet for I                         you, Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Thanks, Duane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave smiles at his friend, then climbs out of the ambulan and heads down the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIMOUSINE comes SCREECHING up to the curb.  The door fl open and Ellen gets out.  She sees the huge crowd of peop at the back of the hospital then looks around the parking lot.  Finally she sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, in the distance, the figure of a lone man in a  paramedics uniform walking slowly away.  He carries a sma black valise in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: A strange composure envelopes her as she makes a silent  decision.  She takes one last look at Dave's receding fig then turns and runs quickly inside the hospital...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA BEGINS TO PULL SLOWLY BACK REVEALING the ambul the hospital and the huge crush of vehicles surrounding t back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The stroke hit at 8:42 p.m. just  as the President was concluding his  remarks to a joint session of Congress.   Spokesmen at Bethesda Naval Hospital  confirm that it was a `massive edema'  and unlike his previous stroke, it has  rendered the President totally  incapacitated... (beat) ... Vice President Nance has already  been conferred with full executive  authority and has assumed the Presidency  in accordance with the 24th Amendment.   This is the first time since...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: It is still autumn.  The sound of the ANNOUNCER'S VOICE  dissolves into the Vice President's as he continues in V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I plan to continue Bill Mitchell's  call to arms.  This isn't my Presidency --  this is his Presidency and I can't  think of a better legacy for him to  leave than...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The autumn leaves are all gone now and the SNOW has start to fall.   Christmas decorations hang from lampposts and Salvation Army Santa is ringing his bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Bob Alexander and eight other  members of the Mitchell Administration  were indicted on thirty-four counts of  election law violations and obstruction  of justice.  Ironically, the indictments  came just forty-eight hours after final  passage of the Bill Mitchell Jobs Bill,  a comprehensive employment program,  designed to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow is falling gently in the street.   The CAMERA BEGINS PUSH IN SLOWLY ON the first floor window.  Jerry (Alice's boyfriend) is hanging a large sign in the window that rea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is just as busy as before.  Alice frantically w the phones while three or four women cram the waiting are Murray supervises a couple of campaign workers including from the start of the film.  They stuff envelopes and wea large "KOVIC" hats on their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to one of the workers) No.  Fold them the long way.  It looks  neater.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE'S INNER OFFICE
dialogues.text: He works the phone, hunched over his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the receiver) What do you mean, Harry, this woman's  fabulous... (beat) Oh no, that was a different one... (longer beat) Well she's changed a lot... (pause) Come on, Harry, it's Christmas, the  woman needs a job. (beat) Well, sure... she can wrap presents...  Yeah you bet... Oh, great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, did you get that fund-raising  thing I sent you?

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY/RECEPTION AREA
dialogues.text: It jars open as a woman steps inside.   Alice barely look as the woman, wearing dark glasses and a scarf, moves int the waiting area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite the blue jeans and T-shirt, she looks quite famil It's Ellen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave moves into the reception area with a huge smile on h face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  We're on a roll now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the women smile up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Christmas time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a catch phrase) .... and everybody works at  Christmas time...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of a sudden they stop.  Dave looks across the recepti area and sees Ellen by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes off her dark glasses and stares at him.  Neithe one of them says a word as Dave moves slowly forward with stunned look on his face.  She smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating her wardrobe)) Thought I needed a little change.  You  like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) It's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves a little closer.   They stand face to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you on T.V... at his funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (past it now) Yeah, well... It's finally over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are inches apart.   Dave notices Murray and the six women staring at them in the waiting area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) C'mere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murray stares as he pulls her into his private office and shuts the door.  Ellen throws her arms around his neck as their lips meet in a passionate kiss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing) I never thought I'd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing back) I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing again) I missed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kiss) ... Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls back and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) So this is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Not exactly the Oval Office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... I lived with a President.  It  isn't any fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave gazes into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softer) It could be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Yeah... It could be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come together in another kiss.   Ellen drops her han to the floor, as the CAMERA WIDENS OUT ON the bustle of t busy office... Outside on the busy Baltimore street... As SLOWLY...
